title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5113.5 - Penalties imposed by commission prior to reissuance of license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5113.5 - Penalties imposed by commission prior to reissuance of license

State Regulations

The commission may require a person ( or business entity
) who (or that) is subjected to disciplinary proceedings, or who (or that)
formerly held a license pursuant to this subchapter, to meet certain conditions
before reissuing a license to that person or business entity, including, without limitation, one of more of the following: (a) restitution of money; (b) restitution of property; (c) making periodic reports to the commission
as required; and
(d) payment of
outstanding fines imposed by the commission. (e) Any or all of the conditions imposed by
the commission pursuant to this Part may be imposed jointly and/or
severally. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5113.5

Amended by

New

York State Register September 24, 2014/Volume XXXVI, Issue 38, eff. 9/24/2014. Amended

New

York State Register November 24, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 47, eff. 11/24/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
